entry.title: Roseburg Forest Products lays off 107 employees, closes Dillard Hardwood Plywood plant
entry.summary: The "Timber Capitol of the World" was just hit by a major blow. One of the area’s major employers, Roseburg Forest Products laid off more than 100 employees last Thursday after closing one of its Dillard plants.

entry.title: Local Real Estate Today with Mary Gilbert — 9/26/25
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:35 a.m. Listen to the latest Local Real Estate Today with Mary Gilbert from the Mary Gilbert Group powered by Place at Keller Williams Southern Oregon.

entry.title: Lotus Media Group hosting flea market sale Saturday
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:30 a.m. Brooke Communications, the parent company for News Radio 93.9 FM and 1240 KQEN, and The News-Review are hosting a community flea market sale Saturday. The sale will be held from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. in the back parking lot of The News-Review building at 345 Northeast Winchester Street in...

entry.title: Reedsport hosts ribbon-cutting ceremony for new tiki room
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:25 a.m. The City of Reedsport is hosting a ribbon-cutting ceremony at the Hoaloha Tiki Room grand opening celebrations Saturday. Mayor Linda McCollum and City Manager Deanna Schafer will be on hand for the event. The event is scheduled from 5-6 p.m. It’s free and open to the public. Hoaloha Tiki Room...

entry.title: Roseburg Forest Products announces end of Hardwood Plywood Plant operations
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:25 a.m. Roseburg Forest Products has closed operations at its Dillard Hardwood Plywood facility and will exit the hardwood plywood market, the company announced Thursday. The Douglas County based lumber company said in a release that the decision was made to reflect the long-term plan for Roseburg Forest Products to concentrate resources...

entry.title: UNF removes public use restrictions
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:22 a.m. The Umpqua National Forest has removed Public Use Restrictions as of Friday morning. Recent rainfall and cooler temperatures have allowed forest management to lift the restrictions and lower the fire danger level to “moderate.” The Industrial Fire Precaution Level will move to level 1 as of 12:01 a.m. Monday. With...

entry.title: “Ghosts of Roseburg” tours offered in October
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:20 a.m. With October and Halloween on the horizon, folks looking for a fright can put a “Ghosts of Roseburg” tour on their calendar. Event organizer Val Gordon said the tours bring to life downtown Roseburg’s dark and colorful spirits. Tour guides will take groups on an approximately 1.5 hour immersive experience...

entry.title: UNF rescinds emergency fire closure order
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:15 a.m. The Umpqua National Forest has rescinded an Emergency Fire Closure Order that was impacting a small portion of the Diamond Lake Ranger District due to the Emigrant Fire. As of Friday, the Upper Lemolo Falls Trail #1476 and trailhead, Skipper Lakes Trailhead, Cinder Prairie Trailhead, Bulldog Rock Trailhead, Lemolo #2...

entry.title: Roseburg library announces fall youth programs
entry.summary: Roseburg Public Library’s fall youth program schedule includes activities for nearly every family.

entry.title: A survivor’s strength: Destiny Molatore’s story of hope and healing
entry.summary: Destiny Molatore was living a fulfilling life with a job she loved and a wonderful family with her husband Tyler and their three children.

entry.title: Douglas, Coos ag students learn how to live, lead with confidence
entry.summary: The Umpqua FFA District Leadership Conference this week inspired students to use their talents to put forward confidence in their work.

entry.title: Sutherlin's Jennifer Bracken is Douglas' teacher of the year
entry.summary: SUTHELRIN — Jennifer Bracken said she likes teaching because she enjoys watching students learn new things and enjoy being at school.

entry.title: Umpqua National Forest to Lift Emigrant Fire Emergency Closure
entry.summary: Umpqua National Forest will lift the Emigrant Fire Emergency Closure on Friday, reopening trails like Upper Lemolo Falls and Skipper Lakes. Roads 2610 and 6000-700 remain closed. A related closure is still in effect on the Willamette National Forest.

entry.title: Blocktober Fest to return to Roseburg for fourth year of fall season fun
entry.summary: As of Sept. 21, it's officially fall again. The autumnal season means the return of apple picking, falling leaves, flocks of turkeys and, for Roseburg residents, an event that brings together residents and business to kick off the time of…

entry.title: Homebuilder appears in court
entry.summary: A former Douglas County homebuilder whose legacy includes millions of dollars in liens, more than $300,000 in fines, dozens of unfinished homes and numerous lawsuits, said he is broke and unable to pay his debts when he appeared in court…
